result.execSummary:
The defendant Cristian C Ramirez-Mahecha was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cristian C Ramirez-Mahecha

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cristian C Ramirez-Mahecha in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Cristian C Ramirez-Mahecha.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Sworn as interpreter: Hilda Shymanik
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Pursuant to plea negotitions and on motion of the state, Court ordered charge AMENDED to a County Ordinance #63.043, Retail Theft to which defendant plead guilty.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered defendant to pay a forfeiture of $100.00 including costs and surcharges by 12-19-2022. Any unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
08-29-2022 Return on Bench Warrant entry made in error.

Defendant Robert G Guevara-Salamanca in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Robert G Guevara-Salamanca.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued. 
Court order signature bond to continue.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cristian C Ramirez-Mahecha in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Sworn as interpreter: Patrick Ryan.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Cristian C Ramirez-Mahecha in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery but no  offer and request time to review and discuss with the defendant. 
State will email defense counsel an offer. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Sworn as Spanish speaking interpreter: Bartholomew, Brenda

Court ordered no contact with All IKEA stores in Wisconsin
No Contact order signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Cristian C Ramirez-Mahecha in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Cristian C Ramirez-Mahecha in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cristian C Ramirez-Mahecha appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.   This hearing may be streamed live through DACAST at the Court's discretion: 
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
